oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Bill of sale for a slave woman in Bledsoe County
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Bill of sale for a "negro woman" purchased by John Parham and signed by Thomas N. Frazier, Clerk & Master dated March 8, 1852. The slave woman's name appears to be Ader. She was sold to Parham for $130 under a decree of the Chancery Court in Pikeville in the suit of Loyd Sebly( et. al. vs. John Parham.
